comments.body: I don't think the `lambda` is necessary here. You should be able to set [`return_value`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#unittest.mock.Mock.return_value) instead.
@samdoran Thanks for reviewing. How would you set `return_value` to be `True` only for that specific path and not for the others?

Oh, I misread this. I thought it was returning the path not the result of an evaluation. I tend to try and avoid `lambda` at all costs (harder to read/maintain usually), but I don't see a better way to write the test.
Makes sense, thanks for checking. I thought this was the most concise way to do it.
